image.altText: A blue banded bee buzzes over a flower.

props.synopsis: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving feral and native bees.

title.children: Residents encouraged to attract more bees as varroa mite spreads

image.altText: Two female students in grey uniforms look at a laptop on a table

props.synopsis: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

title.children: AI app rolls out in SA schools as tech experts warn against 'dumbing down'

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: The actions of a man who imported a child-like sex doll to his family home have been labelled "morally and legally repugnant" by a District Court judge.

title.children: Man jailed until at least 2028 for importing child-like sex doll

image.altText: Aerial image of Andgar's Dublin piggery in South Australia taken by drone in June 2025.

props.synopsis: Emergency crews are at the scene of a fire at a large piggery north of Adelaide that is subject to cruelty allegations.

title.children: Hundreds of pigs feared dead in fire at SA piggery

image.altText: Edan van Haren as a young boy smiling, wearing a striped T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Edan van Haren, a victim of child predator Maurice Van Ryn, says legal loopholes are allowing the confessed paedophile to protect his assets in superannuation to avoid paying compensation.

title.children: Paedophile declares bankruptcy to avoid paying $1.4m in damages

image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

title.children: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million

image.altText: A portrait photo of Max Basheer.

props.synopsis: Max Basheer — the football administrator who oversaw the creation of the Adelaide Crows and the purpose-built stadium Football Park — has died aged 98.

title.children: 'SA giant' who championed entry of Crows, Port into the AFL remembered

image.altText: Wombats in Robe

props.synopsis: A wombat has made its home in the main street of Robe, evidence of an influx of the animals in the South Australian fishing town.

title.children: Wombat makes home in main street bowls club amid habitat loss

image.altText: A black-and-white photo showing shirtless soldiers carrying another soldier on a stretcher near a large fig tree.

props.synopsis: Many of the Rats of Tobruk hailed from the Eyre Peninsula and, after years of work, their legacy has been commemorated by a very special tree taking root.

title.children: Tobruk fig planted in honour of the Rats of the Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: A police vehicle spraying protesters with water.

props.synopsis: Months before anti-immigrant unrest broke out on the streets of London, it erupted in this small UK town.

title.children: Before London erupted, this UK town burnt migrants out of their homes

image.altText: Andrew Hastie doorstop at CPH 2024-04-17 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie indicates he will quit or be dumped from the shadow cabinet if the Coalition does not abandon the target of achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

title.children: Hastie flags demotion or resignation should Liberals not abandon net zero

image.altText: A man with white hair bites his finger.

props.synopsis: The remarks were made as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio visited Israel seeking answers from Mr Netanyahu about how Israel intended to proceed in Gaza.

title.children: Israel's Netanyahu won't rule out striking Hamas 'wherever they are'

image.altText: A woman faces a man in a room. Both are in silouhette.

props.synopsis: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

title.children: Childcare worker accused of abuse says his behaviour was 'misinterpreted'

image.altText: A sad child sits in a chair with their face hidden behind their hair

props.synopsis: A surge of professional and personal interest in Pathological Demand Avoidance (PDA), an autism subtype — which in children can affect everything from cleaning teeth to attending school — has led to Australia's first-ever PDA conference, to be held in Perth in November.

title.children: To protect her children Jenny had to let one of them go, then a diagnosis changed everything

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with white hair and a young white male with brown hair sitting in a park

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government seeks to rein in the cost of the NDIS, a former Australian of the Year says money could be saved with this one shift.

title.children: The NDIS 'ambulance at the bottom of the cliff' that needs fixing

image.altText: Slightly smiling Tim Brigden holds his son, while his wife, with dark blonde hair, smiles and  looks at son.

props.synopsis: Lawyers urge Australians to ensure they leave behind a valid will and avoid legal disputes as house prices rise.

title.children: Lawyer says Australians without a valid will in danger of legal limbo

image.altText: A palawa woman stands facing the camera in front of an artwork

props.synopsis: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

title.children: Constitution helped stop the Franklin Dam. Can it also keep kids out of jails?

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: While substantial fines would apply to social media platforms that make no effort to ban under-16s, they would not need to test the age of every user.

title.children: Social media platforms will not be required to prove accuracy of under-16 bans

image.altText: A man kneels above two large rusty unexploded shells, measuring one of them with measuring tape.

props.synopsis: Trainees in Papua New Guinea will learn to remove unexploded ordnance, as fading memories of World War II expose more people to the conflict's dangerous legacy.

title.children: WWII bombs still killing in PNG. A new project trains locals to remove them

image.altText: Prince Charles and Donald Trump walking on a lawn, dressed in suits.

props.synopsis: The US president will arrive in London on Tuesday evening, local time, for an unprecedented second state visit to the country.

title.children: Castles, trade and Epstein: What's looming over Donald Trump's UK visit

image.altText: Armand Duplantis celebrates

props.synopsis: Kurtis Marschall wins bronze in the men's pole vault final on day three of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, as Armand Duplantis soars to a 14th world record.

title.children: Duplantis breaks world record, Marschall wins world championship bronze

image.altText: A human skeleton, partially excavated from grey-brown sand.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists claim they've found the oldest-known deliberately mummified remains in burial sites across China and South-East Asia, with some individuals dating back 14,000 years.

title.children: Smoked human remains may be oldest-known mummies

image.altText: Townsville protest

props.synopsis: It comes in the wake of anti-immigration rallies held around the country where some blamed "mass migration" for families not being able to afford a home.

title.children: Building industry calls for more migrant workers to address housing crisis

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: It's not the be all and end all — but the impending delivery of the Tasmanian Planning Commission's final report is a major moment for the Macquarie Point stadium.

title.children: Final report into proposed Hobart stadium arrives tomorrow

image.altText: Conor McGregor smiles while kneeling on the octagon floor after defeating Cowboy Cerrone in UFC 246

props.synopsis: Critics say the former MMA fighter's pre-emptive dropout was to save face in a likely knockout at the hands of Dublin City Council.

title.children: Former MMA fighter Conor McGregor drops out of Irish presidential race

image.altText: Albanese at a press conference pointing towards the camera. He wears blue suit and pink tie.

props.synopsis: Amid uncertainty over whether the prime minister will secure his first one-on-one meeting with Donald Trump, the political test is whether his recent defence commitments will be seen as a genuine step-up on capability or a sidestep from American calls to spend more.

title.children: Defence dilemma facing Albanese as he heads to New York

image.altText: A man looks at the TikTok app on an iPad.

props.synopsis: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the framework would see the platform switch to US ownership.

title.children: US says TikTok ownership 'framework' agreed to with China

image.altText: Two metal grey F-16 fighter jets flying side-by-side in the air amid light cloud cover

props.synopsis: A foreign office spokesperson says Russia's incursions into NATO airspace were "utterly unacceptable", adding that the UK stands united with its NATO allies in condemning the "reckless actions".

title.children: Britain summons Russian ambassador following violation of NATO airspace

image.altText: Various items in a state of disarray

props.synopsis: Photos have revealed a chaotic scene inside the Porepunkah property where Dezi Freeman is alleged to have shot and killed two police officers.

title.children: Inside the property where two Victoria Police officers were killed

image.altText: A large group of people stand together outside behind a man speaking into a loudspeaker at a rally

props.synopsis: About 1,000 students hit the streets of the capital to rally against the plan, before police clashed with some protesters who reportedly threw rocks and damaged properties.

title.children: Police clash with protesters in Timor-Leste as new car plan sparks anger

image.altText: an aerial view of a car park after a baby girl died after being hit by a car and another child hospitalised

props.synopsis: Emergency crews were called to the car park of Minto Mall about 3:30pm on Monday afternoon, where the baby and five-year-old child had been struck by a car.

title.children: Baby girl dies, child hospitalised after being hit by car at Sydney car park

image.altText: Silverwater Corrections Complex exterior on a cloudy day, fit with barbed wire.

props.synopsis: An inmate, who cannot be named, provided details of an Indigenous man's treatment in custody, as an inquest into the man's death continues.

title.children: Guards used derogatory slurs about Indigenous man who died, inquest told

image.altText: A man in grey suit

props.synopsis: Christian Brueckner lived in Portugal's Algarve region at the time the three-year-old vanished in 2007 and was first named as a suspect by British and German police in 2020.

title.children: Prime suspect in Madeleine McCann disappearance refuses UK police interview

image.altText: Hannah Einbinder holding an Emmy smiling at the camera, people blurred behind her

props.synopsis: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

title.children: Expletives on live television and some upset wins. Here's how the Emmys played out
